text: 1 IN COLOR: A FULL MOON shines over a picture-perfect Ameri town. PEOPLE, seen in SILHOUETTE, stroll past quaint shop whose signs promise RELIABLE APPLIANCES, WELL-MADE CLOTHE SOLID VALUES. A DINER has a neon sign that offers the "BE EATS IN TOWN". But something is wrong. The neon isn't lit Nothing in town is lit. Street lamps, windows, are all da TCHICK! KA-TCHICK-TCHICK. That DISTURBING SOUND continues Some of the PEDESTRIANS drift into "UNIONTOWN PARK", mill around a GAZEBO, where THREE "MUSICIANS" are struggling w a trombone, a saxophone, and a tambourine. They can't see make the instruments work, except for the tambourine play who is rattling out a few very unrhythmic beats. That's w that sound is coming from. TCHICK! KA-TCHICK-TCHICKY-TCHI A CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALS: The "MUSICIANS" are DEAD. So the "PEDESTRIANS". Flesh is rotting off their bones. The itself, which at first looked so perfect, is ROTTING TOO.
They're trying to be us.
They used to be us.

(Worried) They're learning how to be us again.                                                RILEY DENBO watches the town through binoculars. 32, made rugged by realities, he has a heart beneath his tough exterior. MIKE CONVERSE, 21, young and unseasoned, has th eagerness and passion of someone young and unseasoned.
o way. Some germ or some devil got them things up and walkin'. But there's a big difference between them and us. They're dead! 3

DEAD TEENAGE COUPLE walks hand-in-hand near the gas pumps of a defunct TEXACO STATION. The boy steps on the little that BINGS when a car pulls in. Out of the building comes ...AN ATTENDANT. It was once tall and handsome. Now his f is a wrinkled map of death. He has lost its left arm. Dri blood darkens the shoulder of its jump-suit, where the ar was torn away. A "TEXACO" PATCH tells us the Thing used t work here. Embroidery tells us his nickname was once "BIG DADDY". He goes to the pump and removes the nozzle. Turns if searching for a car to fill with gas. There is none.
It's like they're pretending to be alive.
Isn't that what we're doing, son?                        Pretending to be alive?

5 THE SOUND OF GROANING WOOD as THREE heavily-armed GUERILL push a large CRATE over a PRECIPICE into a deep GARBAGE P below. FIVE SIMILAR CRATES lie amid the rubble. Insects BUZZ. RATS crawl. HUMAN SKELETONS, most HEADLESS, everywhere, no flesh left on their bones. Those with head show various wounds to their skulls. Except for one, whic ...suddenly, startlingly MOVES! Its bony arm reaches up f the bottom of the pit toward...
...CHOLO DeMORA, a Latino in his 20s, handsome, roguish, confident...a bit too confident. He reaches over his shou and unstraps a CROSSBOW.
Poor bastard. WFFFFT! Cholo shoots the skeleton. His arrow goes complet through the WHITE SKULL.
6 The doors of a beat-up WHITE MOVING VAN open. Cholo reach in, throwing back an oilcloth that covers ANOTHER CRATE.
Whole lotta trash this week.
That's life, brother. A whole lotta trash. As the men tip the crate onto a dolly, MAGGOTS are reveal in the darkness beneath, squirming in a POOL OF BLOOD. (What's in that crate?) 7
RILEY and MIKE watch THREE DEAD THINGS lumber toward them
from the town below.
They know we're here. They can smell life. Smell blood.
8 THROUGH THE BINOCULARS: BIG DADDY replaces the nozzle in gas pump. Sensing something, it looks around. Up. His dea eyes lock on Riley's. Big Daddy grunts. Responding to him
9 ...the THREE DEAD THINGS move up the hillside with more determination.
Glancing at Mike's guns) You any good with those?
Dunno. It's my first trip. Never had to use `em before.

Great. I'm out here with a guy who can't shoot. Let's go. Mike stands, turns, and... ...is GRABBED from behind by a ZOMBIE! It's not one of th three they've been watching. This one wears the remains o CLOWN SUIT. Half its bulbous red nose has been eaten away Painted eyelashes make its stare alarming. Its ORANGE HAI crawling with SPIDERS. It wrestles Mike to the ground. Op its lipsticked mouth. Is about to bite Mike's neck when.. ...Riley FIRES his .45. BLAM! A bullet SHATTERS the Clown SHOULDER CAP. The dead thing is pitched backward, but see to feel no pain. It hunkers over Mike again. iley FIRES four more times. THREE BULLETS RIP into the Clown's CHEST, NECK, CHEEK. Finally, the FOURTH PUNCHES A HOLE above the thing's left eyebrow. The Clown DROPS. ike looks at Riley.
Jesus. You can't shoot, neither! 10

RILEY and MIKE step into a tight, uncomfortable space. Generators whir. Gears turn. The two men open a storage locker and strap on ammo belts as... ...SOMETHING TERRIBLE LOOMS out of the shadows! It moves toward Riley and Mike, who can't see it from behind the locker. The LEFT SIDE OF THE THING'S FACE has been BURNED AWAY. Only scar-tissue remains, and a single usable eye bulging from a socket. Riley turns. Sees the thing. And, surprisingly, he relaxe recognizing CHARLIE HOUK, a heavily-armed guerilla whose intellect is as burned as his face.
Tcha doin', Riley?
Havin' a bad dream.
I have bad dreams. Hell, yes. Just look at me, you can tell that I have terrible dreams.
The town is full of walkers.
Every town is full of walkers.
These aren't just walking. They're like...regular folks.
But they're dumb, Riley. Hell, dead folks is near as dumb as me!
You learned how to make yourself useful. That's what they're doing.

They dumped the trash. Cholo's on                       his way. Riley and Mike look across the room in the direction of t voice. Twenty feet away, a WOMAN sits at the controls of looks like a scavenged airplane cockpit that's outfitted a mixture of high- and low-tech equipment. She wears a bl leather jacket with "PRETTY BOY" emblazoned across the ba
(Surprised) Pretty Boy's a dame?
This one is. Last one was a guy.
What happened to him?                                   Pretty Boy turns, poking her finger through a BULLET HOLE encrusted with year-old BLOOD in the chest of her jacket.
I kept his jacket. For good luck.
Luck?
Put some flowers in the graveyard.                      Pretty Boy reaches out and flips a toggle switch on the control panel. THOOMB! THOOMB! DEEP CONCUSSIVE SOUNDS can felt as much as heard as...
y

11 ...RILEY, CHARLIE, and MIKE step out of A VEHICLE the siz of a city bus. The words DEAD RECKONING are painted on it side. This is no bus. It's a war wagon, built of SCAVENGE PARTS with a RIVETED STEEL SKIN. GATTLING GUNS protrude f a MEAN-LOOKING SNOUT. A ROOF TURRET supports two FOURTEEN INCH-CANNONS. Rotating lights SHINE in all directions, piercing the night. THOOMB! THOOMB! THOOMB! That sound again. MORTAR TUBES on vehicle's roof are launching FIREWORKS that BURST in the

(Looking up) `Flowers in the                            graveyard'. Why do you call `em that, Riley? I don't get it. These here flowers ain't the kind you lay down on the ground. These here are sky flowers. Way up in Heaven.
I love ya, Charlie. Know why? Cuzz you still believe in heaven. THE WHITE MOVING VAN rolls in and parks beside Dead Recko CHOLO jumps out with the THREE GUERILLAS from the dump.
You guys scope out the town?

Looks like nobody's hit it before. FOUR GUERILLAS get into an old T-BIRD CONVERTIBLE mounted machine guns. TWO OTHER ARMED MEN climb onto MOTORCYCLES. very night seems to GROWL as everyone starts their engine
Ready?
Always ready. Just look at me ou can tell I'm always ready.
I look at you, all I see's an idiot.
I don't think that's all you see. bet you see this iron, too.
Charlie is wearing four holstered sidearms, two shouldere automatic rifles, a REMINGTON...and a sly smile that make wonder whether he's an idiot or not.
Let's go have some fun.
Ain't about fun, Cholo. VROOOM! The T-Bird and the motorcycles pull out toward to
We go in, do our job, and get out, all of us alive, okay? I don't want                      any fuck-ups on my last day out here.
(Grinning) My last day, too. iley looks surprised. Cholo mounts a MOTORCYCLE, REVS the engine, and heads out.
What'd he do, hit the lottery or somethin'?
Somethin'. (Wondering) Somethin'. Riley and Charlie start to get back into Dead Reckoning. follows, pausing to look up at the "sky flowers".
Do those things really work?
Yup. (Almost sadly) Stenches can't                       take their eyes off `em.

12 DEAD THINGS stand completely frozen in the middle of main street, like statues, mesmerized by the FIREWORKS. Only one figure is moving. BIG DADDY. He weaves between h brothers and sisters, urgently waving his one good hand, like Frankenstein's monster, as if to say "Bad! Bad!" He learned that fireworks bring danger.

A DEAD TEENAGE CHEERLEADER, holding filthy pom-poms, look Big Daddy, unable to grasp what he's trying to communicat A SPEAR is DRIVEN through the Cheerleader's face! The spe is held like a lance by HARRY, a guerilla who roars past his motorcycle hooting like a cowhand on round-up. Other BIKERS rumble down the street, firing guns. Big Daddy watches the Cheerleader fall. It throws its hea back and lets out a great HOWL.
13 THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD: RILEY recognizes BIG DADDY from t gas station. He also recognizes the Thing's anguish as...
14 ...DEAD RECKONING, mortars still shooting FIREWORKS, stop the edge of town. CHOLO pulls up alongside on his bike.
15 THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD: RILEY and MIKE watch the T-BIRD R down MAIN STREET. The FOUR GUERILLAS inside laugh gleeful as they use the MACHINE GUNS to MOW DOWN HAPLESS ZOMBIES.
I thought it was gonna be a battle. This is a fucking massacre.
(Through an open hatch) Kid, these are the toughest guys in the `hood. You can't keep `em from wantin' to get some chuckles. iley gives Cholo an irritated look.

Hey, not me, Boss. You told me not to have any fun, I'm not having any fun at all. (To Mike) Come with me, kid. I'll show you the ropes.                           Mike climbs out and gets on the back of Cholo's motorcycl
Where you goin'?
To get supplies. Essential supplies. That's job our job, ain't it?

16 THE WHITE MOVING VAN pulls up to a supermarket. THE DEAD THINGS in the parking lot, gazing at the FIREWORKS, barel notice the vehicle. MARKSMEN keep the lot covered as GUERILLAS carry CASES OF CANNED GOODS out of the supermar and into the van. The team has this down to a science. ILEY'S VOICE comes over one Guerilla's hand-held radio.
How's the food?
(Into his radio) Lousy, but there's lots of it. 17
DEAD RECKONING RUMBLES down a side street, its steel skin reflecting the FLASH of fireworks.
18 PRETTY BOY drives. RILEY stands beside her.
(Into radio) Number Two, what's your location?
rug store. Need an aspirin? I got a million of `em.
(Into radio) Antibiotics. We need                        antibiotics.
We're set.
(Into radio) Number Three?
19 UERILLAS load boxes of ammo into a JEEP.
(Into radio) Guns and ammo, Boss.

20 HARRY, the biker with the spear, is making another run to a WALKER, who stands mesmerized by the fireworks, when... WHAP! Harry is sent FLYING! DEAD WOMAN, once pretty, wearing a softball uniform that bears the NUMBER NINE, has used its bat to hit a home run Harry's riderless motorcycle fishtails up the street and the side of a building. arry tries to get up. TWO DEAD THINGS attack him. Another motorcycle, driven by ANCHOR, who looks like Popeye, RUMB up in the nick of time.
Harry, jump on! Fighting off the Dead Things, Harry gets on and speeds aw
21 PRETTY BOY turns a corner. Out the windshield, RILEY sees 22
...CHOLO and MIKE, on Cholo's bike, joining up with FOXY, red-haired guerilla on his own motorcycle. The three driv toward the end of town.
What the fuck?
23 CHOLO SCREECHES to a stop at a LIQUOR STORE with MIKE and FOXY. All dismount and start toward the entrance. They st as DEAD RECKONING pulls up and RILEY and CHARLIE climb ou
Nothin' in there but booze. Booze ain't essential.
A jug of good Kentucky goes for fifteen hundred back in town.
(To Cholo) I'm not risking anybody's ass just so you can pick up some side money.
Not askin' you to. Cholo and Foxy start into the liquor store. The doors are wide open. All that can be seen from outside is darkness.
Mike! Wait!                                              But Mike has followed the others inside. 2

4 CHOLO unstraps his crossbow and leads the way cautiously into the dark space. Every subtle SOUND in the SILENCE pu MIKE more on edge. His hand tenses on his gun as SHADOWS in front of him. Shadows that could be zombies, but are n Behind the dusty glass doors of a once-refrigerated wall- unit, Cholo sees a CASE OF DOM PERIGNON. He goes to the refrigerator. Re-strapping his crossbow, he opens the doo Reaches in for the case of champagne. His two hands grab

Cholo looks up. The refrigerator has no back wall. A DEAD THING with a Manson-like SWASTIKA tattooed in the center its forehead has stepped in from the shadows of a loading area beyond. It GRABS Cholo with a terrifying GROWL. Cholo falls under the weight of the champagne, and the weight of the Dead Thing, which drops on top of him. They roll, struggling. The Thing holds Cholo in a death grip. At the front of the store, Mike fumbles with his rifle. Foxy shoots at the Dead Thing and misses. Cholo PUNCHES the Thing with his free hand. The Dead Thin head recoils, but lowers again toward Cholo, the Swastika looming, drooling teeth baring for a bite. Cholo's eyes flash. It's the first time we've seen him scared. BLAM! CHARLIE FIRES one round, right into the center of t swastika on the Zombie's forehead. The Thing crumples.
Nice shootin'.
Good shootin'. Ain't no such thing                       as nice shootin'.
o
A FOOT KICKS the Zombie off Cholo, who looks up to see... ...RILEY extending a hand to help him to his feet.
Close one.

I'm still here, ain't I?                                Everyone relaxes. Cholo picks up the case of Dom. The oth head toward the front of the store. TILT DOWN TO THE FLOOR as their feet move past. In the gl behind stacks of cartons... ...A DEAD HAND appears. Reaching.

Shit! Look out, kid!                                    The hand grabs Mike around the ankle! Mike turns, raising gun. Too late. A DEAD UNIFORMED POLICEMAN, the skin on half its face STR DOWN TO BONE, RIPS A HOLE IN HIS LEG with its teeth! ike SCREAMS, staggers into a wall, and drops to a seated position on the floor. Riley and Charlie spin around at t sound of his cry. Cholo, closest to Mike, pulls his cross and fires an arrow through the Zombie's head.
Fuckin' rookies. Cholo tucks away the crossbow, grabs a box of Cohibas off counter, and runs outside with Foxy. Riley goes to Mike.
(Kneeling) It's alright, son. You're gonna be alright.
No. I'm dead. You get bit by one f those things and you become what they are. Riley wraps a strong arm around Mike and lifts him. Mike quickly plants the barrel of his .45 under his chin and..
iley, stunned, lets the corpse slide to the floor. He loo into the rookie's open eyes, devastated.

25 THE WHITE MOVING VAN, THE T-BIRD, AND THE JEEP roll out o town in a convoy. Trailing them, THREE SADISTIC GUERILLAS MOTORCYCLES ROAR past, firing... ...a HAIL OF BULLETS at A DEAD FAMILY on the sidewalk. Th MOTHER FALLS. Not shot. It has been GRABBED and SHOVED do to the ground by... ...BIG DADDY! Who GRABS the little GIRL next, thrusting h roughly behind the protection of a wrecked car. The FATHE last. Big Daddy grabs it from behind, by its hair, just a ...ROUNDS from an UZI DRILL A DOTTED-LINE across the Fath neck. Big Daddy is unhurt, but spattered with BLOOD. Not greenish-black. The blood of the dead.

here's a RIPPING SOUND as the Father's NECK is PULLED APA by the weight of its limp body. The body DROPS to the str The HEAD remains suspended in Big Daddy's hand. His face contorts. His mouth opens and closes, trying to utter sou ig Daddy drops the head, looking down at its befuddled ey with sympathy. After a moment, the sympathy is joined by rage. Big Daddy lifts his right foot and brings it STOMPI DOWN on the disembodied head, CRUSHING ITS SKULL. The convoy ROARS off, leaving a cloud of exhaust. Big Dad sees Harry's downed motorcycle lying in the street. The b of an AUTOMATIC RIFLE protrudes from a saddlebag. Big Daddy goes over. Pulls out the rifle. Tests the weigh it in his hand. Curls his finger in through the guard and pulls the trigger. BLAM! A bullet ricochets off a brick wall. Big Daddy is startled at first. Then, he relaxes, realizing the rifle' power. With surprising dexterity, he slings the weapon's strap over his head and across his chest, patting the str as if comforted by it. Turning, he looks toward... ...THE DISTANT GLOW OF A SKYSCRAPER that can be seen ON T HORIZON. That's the direction the convoy is headed. That' where the bad men came from. That's where he wants to go.

With the city in the distance, Big Daddy starts walking. NUMBER NINE falls into step beside him. Soon there are MO None of them knows where they are going. Or why. All that seems to matter is that they have a leader.

26 DEAD RECKONING, emitting tendrils of HOT STEAM from twent steel nostrils, stands parked in a corner of a fenced-in outdoor yard. (We don't see how big the yard is. Yet.) A SEARCHLIGHT sweeps the darkness as GUERILLAS unload the supplies they took from Uniontown and carry them toward.. ...a set of RUSTY STEEL DOORS, above which is a FADED SIG that reads "SUBWAY (TO CITY)". In the bustle of activity, HARRY, the biker who was attac in town, perspires as he helps unload. He looks ill. RILEY walks past, handing out bottles of beer to the men.
Harry. Beer? Harry doesn't answer.

Harry?                                                   Harry SPINS! GROWLS! LUNGES at Riley like a beast! Riley has no time to reach for his gun. The Harry-Thing i strangling him. SMASHING the neck of a beer bottle on the snout of Dead Reckoning, Riley JAMS THE JAGGED GLASS into the Harry-Thing's forehead. Its body drops to the ground.
Got knocked off his bike in town. Must have been bit.                                      Riley looks down at the body with a mixture anger and reg

27 A mile-long subway tunnel extends into BLACKNESS. A wide PLATFORM runs the length of the tracks, at the head of wh A DERELICT TRAIN is parked. A CARGO CARRIER pulls out, driving along the platform, it flatbed piled with supplies, while ANOTHER CARRIER is bei loaded with boxes of food, pharmaceuticals, ammunition, a TWO BODY BAGS.
Shit happens, Riley.
(Blaming himself) Only if you let it.

The cargo carrier that was first to pull out drives into tunnel. CEILING LIGHTS spaced far apart STUTTER on and of Two guerillas, ANCHOR and MOUSE, who looks like a mouse, on the open flatbed with the cargo. The tunnel is filled with looming steel shapes that cast menacing shadows. Mouse shifts nervously. Suddenly... ...PLINK! SOMETHING WET FALLS ON HIS FACE! He JUMPS. Recovers. Wipes his cheek with his sleeve.
I hate going under the fuckin' river. He takes out a joint. Lights up. The match FLARES. SPLAT! Mouse and the match are soaked by WATER dripping from abo 28
RIVERS flank a TRIANGLE OF LAND where A CITY glows in the sunrise. Once proud and prosperous, its buildings now see like tombstones. SEVEN BARRICADED BRIDGES span the rivers

Protected on three sides by mighty                      rivers, the city stands as a monument                   to man's ingenuity. At the center of it all is Fiddler's Green.                              29
A TV MONITOR broadcasts views of A KITCHEN, A PLUSH LIVIN ROOM, A DEN with a VIDEO FIREPLACE.

Luxury living in the grand old style.                   Dine at one of three restaurants. Look for that perfect gift in our fabulous shopping mall. he monitor shows a huge ATRIUM with shops and restaurants
They make it sound nice.

It is nice.                                             Holding his case of Dom Perignon and his box of Cohibas, CHOLO looks with FOXY at a monitor mounted to a white-til subway station wall. Down the tunnel behind them, the oth GUERILLAS unload supplies from CARGO CARRIERS parked on t platform. A sign reads, "GOLDEN TRIANGLE/FIDDLER'S GREEN"
f
(Approaching) Cholo.                                    Foxy moves away, leaving Riley and Cholo alone.
Two people dead. That kid, Mike. He                     should be here with us right now.
I didn't kill him. He got bit and he killed himself. Same thing I woulda done. And you! iley lunges at Cholo, takes hold of his shirt, and SLAMS him against the wall.
The fuck are you turning into, man?
e take money to do nasty shit. Shit that nobody else is dumb enough to do. We go in knowing the risks. The kid did too. His number came up, that's all.
We take the risk to bring in things                     people need. Not to make a few extra bucks selling liquor. You                         used to know that.
Everybody makes their own way. verybody makes their own ucking way! holo shrugs out of Riley's grasp. Behind them, the gueril continue to unload cargo.

y daddy...he picked fruit, penny- a-piece. He never went for anything, so he never had anything. I'm gonna have a place, Riley. My                       own place! And now I got enough                         money to buy my way in.
Isn't it time? Isn't it your time? For Fiddler's Green.
Cholo looks up at the TV monitor. Riley follows his gaze, seeing well-dressed PEOPLE sipping cocktails in a club ro

You're dreaming, Cholo. They'd never let me in. They'll never let you in. We're the wrong kind. The image on the TV MONITOR changes to an overhead view o the city and its rivers. Animation draws a RED LINE along base of the "golden triangle", a zone known as "THE THROA
Bask in the security of a city protected not only by its natural boundaries, but by hand-picked members of its own private militia.
30 In live action, not on the   monitor, WEARY TROOPS, slopp uniformed, guard four rows   of electrified, barbed-wire DEAD THINGS cluster by the   DOZENS outside the barricade
CORPSES hang all along the   stretch, suspended on the ba
Stench! Ten o-clock! A WALKER lumbers in and touches the fencing. SPARKS FLY! Thing's flesh is literally COOKED! BOILS develop, POPPING OPEN, emitting SMOKE. Still the Thing remains animated.
Take its fuckin' face off. UDDA-BUDDA-BUDDA! The Military Woman FIRES. The Thing is decimated. Its body hangs, welded to the SPARKING barbs. 3
1 CHOLO approaches a CHECKPOINT manned by TWO SECURITY GUAR Setting down the champagne and Cohibas, he unstraps his weapons and hands them over.
DeMora. Supply unit
What's in them boxes?
Essential supplies. For the man upstairs. l

The Guard takes Cholo's weapons and returns a claim check CHOLO collects his boxes and steps onto an escalator that carries him up into an ENORMOUS ATRIUM. The "mall" we saw TV. SUNLIGHT splashes through glass walls onto box-plante trees. Caged birds CHIRP seemingly in tune with the Chopi that lilts over a sound system. SHOPPERS, expensively ove dressed, stroll past stores. OTHER RESIDENTS lunch at "outdoor" cafes. Cholo pulls out a kerchief and wipes the smudges off his face, trying to make himself presentable. 3

2 FIDDLER'S GREEN, a heavily protected HIGH-RISE in the cen of the city, dominates the skyline. It's where the Fat Ca live, protected from urban decay. The building is surroun by unoccupied high-rises that define "the golden triangle clean section in the center of the city. No ugliness in v RILEY and CHARLIE cross a manicured plaza to a CHECKPOINT manned by TWO SECURITY GUARDS. Riley hands over his ID.
Quittin' time, Deke.
(Holding up the ID) You're gonna need this.
(Walking on) Nope. When I said                           quittin' time, I meant quittin'                          time.

33 RILEY and CHARLIE walk down a street into the city's "ghe zone, which is lined with taverns, gambling clubs, strip joints, like a boom town from Alaskan gold-rush days. BUY and SELLERS lurk in the shadows, copulating, dealing drug iley is welcomed by nearly everyone he passes, greeting them in return with a smile and a nod, handing some bills a FATHER with a YOUNG SON, patting an OLD MAN on the back
Wanna get a drink, Riley? Just ook at me, you can tell I could use a drink.
Later. Gotta see a man about a car.

Charlie follows Riley, who strides into... ...an alley, surprised to find a cadre of rough-looking REVOLUTIONARIES, led by MULLIGAN, a defiant man who stand on a soapbox. A small audience is gathered in front of hi He takes a swig from a bottle of whiskey.

Irish accent) How long are you                         gonna let him push you around? If                       there was enough of us...if you all                     would join up with us...we could                        pull him down off his throne!                           Some of the people in the audience nervously shift their to the FIDDLER'S GREEN HIGH-RISE ten blocks away.
You can't fix a place like this,                        Mulligan. You just have to get out                      of it.

We've got the firepower, Riley. If you and your friends would come in                      with us, we'd be unstoppable.                           Mulligan holds out his bottle to Riley, who passes it to Charlie, who takes a swig.
Everyone's stoppable.                                   We hear the sound of a boy coughing. Mulligan's son BRIAN stands behind him, looking feverish.
You alright, son?
I'm fine, dad.                                          As Riley starts past, he stops, pulls something from his pocket, and presses it into Mulligan's palm.
Antibiotics. For your boy.                              Mulligan looks down with gratitude at a bottle his hand. When he looks up again, Riley is gone.

34 Turning a corner, RILEY and CHARLIE stop in front of a rundown GARAGE with a tarp hanging down instead of a door Riley pulls it aside and looks in. A HOBO lies asleep on grease-stained floor, curled under some old newspapers.
Where's the car?
(Waking) What car?
My new car. I paid for it. I was                       here yesterday. There were two guys getting it ready for me.
There was nobody here this morning.
Sonofabitch!
What happened, Riley. Didja get fucked? Riley stands there, grim-faced.
(A whisper) Come on.

ING! An elevator door opens. CHOLO, carrying the champagn and Cohibas, steps out, walks to "PENTHOUSE NUMBER ONE", rings the bell. An instant after he pushes the button... ...the door is JERKED OPEN by TYLER KNIPP, 50-something, African American man in a white butler's jacket. Frighten he's wielding a SCISSORS, poised to strike.

(Lowering the scissors) Oh, Mister                     DeMora. Mister Kaufman ain't home                      and there's some shit goin' down.                      No lie. I heard...                                     A SCREAM RINGS OUT down the corridor!
I heard that!                                          3
Oh, man. Mister K. sure gonna be                        upset about this.                                       Cholo drops his boxes and moves down the corridor.

I called Security. They should be                       here...                                                 Cholo reaches the door to PENTHOUSE NUMBER TWO. It's lock ANOTHER SCREAM from inside. He FLINGS himself at the door The LATCH SPLINTERS out of the frame. The door BURSTS ope

6 ...and CHOLO enters a dark foyer. The only light comes fr another room somewhere inside. A soft, rhythmic SQUEAK, l a child's swing moving back and forth, ECHOES through the apartment. It's an eerie, incongruous sound. On guard, eyes straining, Cholo moves inside. The squeak louder, the light brighter as he turns a corner and sees. ...a MIDDLE-AGED MAN, HANGING DEAD from a HOMEMADE NOOSE suspended from a light fixture in the kitchen! THE BODY S slowly, the harsh glare making the man's face even whiter than it is. A toppled chair lies on the floor at his feet Cholo stands transfixed for an instant. And in that insta ...HE IS GRABBED FROM BEHIND! He whirls, ready to kill, b finds only a MIDDLE-AGED WOMAN, 60-something, wearing a tailored suit and expensive jewelry, her perfectness blemished only by her hysteria.
My Johnny, he killed himself, he                        killed himself. My Johnny! My                           Johnny!                                                 Cholo shakes her, hard.

Keep it together, lady.                                 Behind them, in the kitchen, unseen, a dazed YOUNG MAN, w up to the hanging corpse. He rights the toppled chair and steps on it, lifting a paring to knife cut through the no
(Softly, to himself) Dad. Oh, Dad.
(To Cholo) Se-Security. Are you                         Security?
No, I...

Just as he tosse it to Riley, they hear...GROWLING! he team draws their weapons, standing in a loose circle, their backs to each other, guns searching for a target. Darting eyes peer into the void. MORE NOISES emanate from somewhere. Everywhere. Slowly... ...Charlie unstraps his Remington. Licks his thumb. Wets sight of the rifle. LACK
(A whisper) Why do you do that?                         CHARLIE
(Whispering back) Catches the                           light. Right now it's moonlight. Lets me see where I'm aimin'. BLAM! Charlie FIRES! A single shot into the black smoke. SLACK
The hell you shooting at? CHARLIE
That thing.

DEAD MAN steps out of the smoke! Before anyone can react, grabs Slack's shoulder from behind! She whirls around. Pu away. Is about to shoot when she sees AN ENTRY WOUND on t left side of the Thing's forehead. CHARLIE (CONT'D)
ff-center. But I got him. The Thing relaxes its grip and drops at Slack's feet. ANOLETE

(Hysterical) There's more of `em out                    there. I can hear `em. THERE'S MORE! There are SHUFFLING SOUNDS in the smoke. Manolete backs a Pillsbury grabs him. Slaps him, hard, across the face.
y
If they is more, we gonna need o guns. Pull `em out n'stann up wid us, like de man you ain't. Riley lifts Teahouse's Motorola and pushes "Send".
Riley Denbo. Calling the Green.
LOSE ON: SUTHERLAND'S alarmed face.
What? A TROOPER, equally alarmed, is reporting.
Wiped out! That's what he said! Denbo! He said the depot was wiped out by stenches!
Thank you. Keep us informed.
64 RILEY and his TEAM move through DRIFTING SMOKE. VEHICLES scattered about. They stop at the T-BIRD. There are no ke in the ignition.
Gotta go get the keys, Riley. iley looks across the lot to the CHARRED RUIN of a shack. Tire fires BURN around it. Debris smolders.
Ain't no keys to get. Melted.
Screw keys. Hot wire the fucker. MANOLETE climbs in and goes to work under the dash.
e feelin' better since I hit `im. Suddenly, CHARLIE draws his .45 and FIRES AT SLACK! BLAM! bullet buzzes just above her ear, blowing a WISP OF HAIR .
S
...A DEAD OLD MAN BEHIND HER DROPS, a HOLE in its head. LACK
Thanks, Charlie. That was useful. The WIND shifts and black SMOKE envelopes them. MANOLETE

I can't see! Riley pulls out a flashlight and shines it under the dash he team fans out around the T-Bird. The smoke is so thick they can't make out anything. Including each other. harlie peers into openings that shift on the breeze. What he doesn't see, what he can't see, is what's behind him.. ..a FEMALE WALKER, wearing the soiled and tattered remnan of a bridal gown. The fabric seems to glow in the smoke. The bride shuffles toward CHARLIE. We see it coming. No o else does. Just as it opens its mouth to bite... BLAM! Slack SHOOTS! Her bullet cuts closer than the one Charlie fired, CLIPPING OFF THE TOP OF HIS EAR before DROPPING THE BRIDE. SLACK
Even-Steven. CHARLIE
Not! That hurt! I didn't hurt you! Manolete fumbles with colored wires under the dash. RILEY
Hurry up.                                              PILLSBURY
(Impatient) Yellow to red! TEAHOUSE
What the fuck does a Samoan know about hot-wiring cars? PILLSBURY
Five thousand cars. Stole. Every year in Samoa. MANOLETE
Fifty thousand in Mexico. R
PILLSBURY
Mexico got a million cars. Samoa got five thousand. Every one. Stolen. THE T-BIRD'S ENGINE REVS. MANOLETE

Riley leads the team into the T-Bird. Manolete starts to out from under the dash. As TEAHOUSE settles into a seat the door... ...SOMETHING heavy and wet SMACKS his shoulder. It's a FOREARM! It drops onto Teahouse as if thrown at him. TEAHOUSE

God! Oh, GOD, WHAT'S THIS?! Teahouse HURLS the bloody thing onto the asphalt. Shockin the ARM SPRINGS BACK, THUMPING against Teahouse's face! A twist of torn muscle, no thicker than clothesline, is kee the limb loosely attached to... ...A DEAD THING that has crawled beside the T-Bird. Lifti itself, it BITES a large filet out of Teahouse's arm. CHA
SHOOTS it. anolete climbs up behind the wheel and...VROOOOOM!...peda to the metal he pulls out of the depot. Slack glances at Teahouse, then, wind in her hair, leans in close to Riley SLACK
(Softly) How long does he have? RILEY
I had a brother. Real brother, by birth. Bit. Hung on for six days. Before he turned. I was the one had to shoot him. SLACK
And you said nothin' bad ever happened to you. RILEY
That happened to my brother. SLACK
(Into his eyes) But you kept going. ILEY
Got to, right?
up. Dead is dead. And that ain't you. And that ain't me. Slack turns to Teahouse.
orry, man. I truly am. She draws her .45, aims at Teahouse, and FIRES.
65 KAUFMAN paces with a cigar, passing SUTHERLAND, STYLES, and CLIFF.

I recognize that some of you are concerned. We've been threatened by a disgruntled employee. I've sent people out to take care of the problem. However, should something go wrong, I want to assure you that measures have been taken. I've established outposts. With food and supplies to support us on our way.
On our way? To where?
Alternate sites have been chosen. Air transport has been arranged. For us and our families. As well as necessary support personnel.
What about all the others? Kaufman looks at Cliff, as if expecting him to understand
All the others can be replaced. y others.
But...
Cliff, let me talk to you for a moment. Kaufman leads Cliff into...

...an alcove on the far side of the room, shutting two po doors made of sandblasted glass. Sutherland and the other can't hear, but can see, Kaufman and Cliff in SILHOUETTE. ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE DOORS: Kaufman leans close to Cl smiling, his eyes blinking a bit too rapidly. KAUFMAN (CONT'D)
You interrupted me. I was just                          talking about how people can be replaced. You don't want to be replaced, do you? CLIFF
Nervous) No. KAUFMAN

No, and I don't want to replace you. You have promise. A day may come when you earn yourself some responsibilities. Right now, the responsibilities are mine. All                          the responsibilities. It was my                         ingenuity that took an old world and made it into something new. I                       put up fences to make it safe. I                        hired soldiers and paid for their training. I keep the people on the streets away from us by giving them their games and vices. It costs me money! But I spend it because the responsibility is mine! Now do you                      understand "responsibility"? CLIFF
Yes, but... KAUFMAN
No buts. CLIFF
But... Kaufman looks disappointed. Taking Cliff by the arm, smil again, he leads him over to an outer door and opens it. A armed SECURITY GUARD stands in the corridor outside. KAUFMAN
Take him out with the rest of the garbage. I won't be needing this man anymore.
At the conference table, Sutherland sees the light coming from the outer corridor, better defining the silhouettes the Security Guard drags Cliff away.
(To Styles) Pretty soon it's going to be one of us.
66 n an overgrown suburban street, a LAWN TRACTOR, driven by GARDENER in work clothes, drives back and forth, back and forth, over a swath of dead grass. The gardener is DEAD t
67 CHOLO watches the GARDENER through the windshield.
If I don't have this truck, I'm no different to Kaufman than that poor Mexican bastard out there. CLOSE ON: CHOLO'S WATCH. 11:20.
He's never gonna pay.
He knows it's his ass if he doesn't. Cholo slides open a small window, grabs his crossbow, and SHOOTS the Gardener in the head.

8 ANGLE ON: A SOLID WALL OF WOOD. BIG DADDY, NUMBER NINE, a OTHERS OF THE DEAD push against it. The wood holds. Big Daddy turns, surveying his troops. Focusing on the BUTCHER. On the meat cleaver it has in its hand. Big Daddy pounds on the wood, demonstrating. Points at th meat cleaver. Pounds again. The Butcher gets it. Approach the wall. HACK! The meat cleaver chops into wood, splintering it. REVERSE ANGLE: from the other side of the wall as the woo splinters to reveal BIG DADDY'S EYES staring through at.. ...the FIDDLER'S GREEN HIGH-RISE, looming closer than it before, though it's still across the river.
69 CLOSE ON: a small, electronic unit, the size and appearan of a "Game Boy". AN LED SCREEN shows a BLINKING RED DOT moving along a MAP.

Turn left up here.                                     SLACK, driving the T-BIRD now, makes the turn. The car bl through a deserted town, moving fast. Riley notices that Slack is effected by the desolation she sees.
How long since you been out here?
Never been out. Lived in the city since...it was a regular city.
Pull over.
(Surprised) Huh?

You said you were going to make yourself useful. Right now what I could use is for you to pull over. he does. The T-Bird stops along a road bordered by a MARS thick with tall CAT TAILS. Unexpectedly, Riley stands and points his automatic at PILLSBURY and MANOLETE.

I made a deal with your boss. Find Cholo. I'm gonna do it. Keep him from                  blowing up the Green. I'm gonna do it, I don't want people to get hurt. Bring back Dead Reckoning... Sorry. That's where I stop. I didn't ask him                  for much, just guns, ammo, and a car. I've got the guns. I've got the ammo. And if I find Dead Reckoning I'm gonna have the best fucking car                        that's ever been built, and I'm taking it to Canada. If any of you don't like that idea... Riley reaches down and opens the passenger door. Manolete looks out and sees the CAT TAILS MOVING. THREE WALKERS ar slogging through the marsh. C R R
MANOLETE
Some choice. PILLSBURY
ood choice. I like see Canada. Pillsbury reaches out and slams the car door closed again ILEY
Charlie, keep these two covered. Charlie pulls his .45. Riley turns around his seat, glancing down again at the " Boy" in his palm. The RED DOT has moved on to ANOTHER MAP RILEY (CONT'D)
Take a right onto Route Six. Slack pulls out. SLACK
This is what you were thinking about all along. You got me out here figuring I'm a boy scout, and now you're telling me we're just                        stealing a fucking car? ILEY
You have a problem with that? SLACK
No. I like the way you think. HARLIE
I like the way he thinks, too. Just look at me you can tell I like the way he thinks. RILEY
Take another right.                                     SLACK

How do you know which way you're                        going?                                                  Riley holds up the "Game Boy". It BEEPS SOFTLY as the RED shifts onto another MAP. RILEY
I built a homing device into Dead                       Reckoning. If Cholo's anywhere within                   fifty miles, we can track him.
70 DEAD RECKONING stops on a long road, at the end of which stands... ...a MILITARY COMPLEX. THE BEAM of a SEARCHLIGHT sweeps b and forth over the buildings, a sign of life.
71 CHOLO checks his watch. 11:29. He speaks into a TRANSMITT
Mouse. Anything?
72 MOUSE stands in the shed, holding a transmitter of his ow
Not yet. No boat. No money. No nothing.                                                73
I'm telling you, he's never gonna pay.
That's why we're here.                                  CHOLO looks out the window to the searchlight sweeping ov the military complex in the distance.
74 SLACK drives as RILEY monitors his "Game Boy".
Shit. He's going to Ross Park.
What's there?
Powder magazine. Where they keep                        the big boomers. Rockets. For Dead                      Reckoning's cannons.

75 MOUSE looks at a GRIMY WINDOW as the SHADOW of a WALKER s just beyond the glass. Mouse FIRES a BURST shattering the window and dropping the Walker. Silence. Mouse takes a tentative step toward the window. SCRATCHING SOUND. SOMETHING climbs up onto the sill from outside. Mouse raises his gun, but hesitates when he sees ...it's a child. A GIRL SCOUT. It died at age nine, still wearing its uniform. Now, it's voracious. It grabs Mouse' gun-hand. The weapon FIRES harmlessly into the floor. Mou is about to be chomped when... ...a STALAGMITE OF GLASS in the top of the shattered wind drops, PIERCING the Girl Scout's head. Mouse runs SCREAMING to the door, where he is grabbed by another DEAD THING. And another. As he is TORN APART, he that there are DOZENS MORE.

head_text.subj: ...AN ARMY OF THE DEAD LINING THE RIVERBANK FOR AS FAR AS

text: CLOSE ON: BIG DADDY. Only the river now flows between he his goal: FIDDLER'S GREEN HIGH-RISE, so near and yet so f 76
WHAM! The door SLAMS behind KAUFMAN as he enters the foye KNIPP emerges from the rear.
Any word from Mister Denbo, sir?
No. Pack us up. We might have                           to be leaving.
In the helicopters?
We'll only need one of them.

77 PRETTY BOY eases the vehicle up the road to the complex o buildings: ROSS PARK, a sprawling munitions depot. The searchlight continues to sweep across the night, but ONE is manning it. It's mounted to an automatic rotator o the roof of the main building.
Looks like no one's here.                               The gates stand wide open. There's no sign of life. CHOLO punches a button. The SIDE HATCH HISSES OPEN.
Foxy. You're elected. Get out there and see what the fuck.                                  Foxy moves out through the open hatch.
Somebody go out and help. SCAR grabs his weapons.
I'll go.

78 ONE OF THE DEAD TOPPLES face first into the water, droppi out of sight. ANOTHER FALLS. BIG DADDY looks at the spot where his brothers fell in. He looks for a long time, coc his head like a puppy trying to understand a high wind. The first Dead Thing slowly rises out of the water. Then Second. They stand, waist deep, in the shallows. Big Daddy gazes down at the water, a concept dawning. The with grim purpose, he steps deliberately off the low wall Hitting the river, he manages to stay on his feet. Standi waist deep, with the others, he scoops up water with his good hand. Sniffs it. Tastes it. He looks up. Sees the CITY LIGHTS REFLECTED ON THE RIVER. tries to express his thoughts. All that comes from his mo is a series of inarticulate moans. He's incapable of transmitting his idea. So he does what he's been doing si Uniontown. He leads. He walks toward the city. Out of the shallows. Into deep water. Over his head.

79 There are AUTOMOBILE TIRES, GARBAGE CANS, a rusted ANCHOR sunken MOTOR BOAT, HUNDREDS of BEER BOTTLES...AND THOUSAN OF DEAD THINGS...WALKING...ON THE RIVER BOTTOM...followin BIG DADDY through the debris.
80 A knock on a door is answered by A MAN who looks a bit to greasy to be important. SUTHERLAND is outside.
How much is Kaufman paying you and                      your men?
Four hundred a day. Each.
I'll pay you five thousand a day. Each.                                                   81
The car speeds down the road with SLACK at the wheel.
82 RILEY looks at his watch. 11:40.
83 The unmanned SEARCHLIGHT scans the yard, casting intermit shadows.
This place is important. The men                        here wouldn't just walk out.

Maybe they had no choice.                               FOXY and SCAR move toward a large STORAGE BUILDING where door swings in the night breeze, SLAPPING alarmingly agai the wall. Beyond the opening is a BLACK MAW, like a velve curtain, past which nothing can be seen.
There could be stenches in there. (Readying his M-16) Got a flashlight?

Scar nervously pulls out a flashlight. As he CLICKS on th BEAM, he loses his grip. The flashlight drops to the grou Scar reaches for it. His fingers tip it and it spins. The beam WASHES across his shoes. Then Foxy's shoes. Then fin ...ONE OTHER SHOE. Someone else's. Gasping, Scar grabs th flashlight, shining the beam up onto what should be a leg but there's nothing left above its bloody shin. PLIP! PLOP! PLIP! Beads of BLOOD hit the floor, dropping from the DARK FIGURE of a SOLDIER who is approaching. Sca aims the flashlight at the figure's face, recognizing...

Brubaker! You okay? Where's the                          other guys? What happened here?                          Brubaker keeps coming. He has BULLET HOLES in his chest, they're not what's dripping blood. It's another half-eate FOOT that he's carrying. BRUBAKER IS DEAD. Foxy shoots hi Foxy and Scar move into a hangar-like space. Pitch black. Except for the mote-filled BEAM from Scar's flashlight, w illuminates a supply of enormous cannon shells, lined up storage shelves. THE "JOHNSONS". SIX DEAD SOLDIERS are hunkered in the shadows, EATING the REMAINS of OTHER DEAD SOLDIERS. Foxy grimly raises his weapon. As he squeezes the trigger the sound of the gunfire OVERLAPS into... 84
ANCHOR and SCAR wrestle TWO "JOHNSONS" into place.
That's good. That's all we need.
(Sober) To blow up the Green.
85 THE T-BIRD rumbles along a road lined with large HOMES, o prized for their panoramic views. RILEY'S "Game Boy" BEEP The display shows the RED DOT moving along a MAP.
Cholo's moving out. Looks like he's                      heading right for us.
Riley looks outside. Beyond the homes he can see THE CITY
hit. Off this hillside...they can shell the Green. Pull in! There! SLACK pulls into a driveway, stopping the T-Bird in the shadow of one of the houses.
hey'll be coming up this road.
86 In a walk-in STEEL-WALLED SAFE, KAUFMAN pulls out banded STACKS OF MONEY and stuffs them into TWO PRADA DUFFELS. 87

ONE HEAD RISES out of the river. It's BIG DADDY, rivulets water running down the creases of his face. Another head rises. And another. NUMBER NINE and the BUTCHER ZOMBIE. More and more heads break the surface. The water FILLS wi BODIES emerging from the deep. HUNDREDS OF THEM. The CITY LIGHTS REFLECT off their wet clothes as the ARMY OF THE D clambers up a boat ramp on the city side of the river.
88 RILEY and HIS TEAM wait in the shadows of the driveway th pulled into. They HEAR the distant GROWL of DEAD RECKONIN Looking over a hedge-row, Riley can see HIGH BEAMS advanc
(To the Others) Y'all stay here.
You're goin' out there alone? You                       need our guns.
Dead Reckoning's got steel skin an                      inch thick. You can't shoot your                        way in. I'm hopin' I can talk my                        way in.
He's gonna steal the truck and                          leave us here.
Riley'd never do that. Just look at                      him, you can tell he'd never do that.

Keep an eye on the hatches. If I                         get in, I'll try to leave one open.                      Riley takes off. Charlie looks torn. He wants to go with Riley, but he has to keep PILLSBURY and Manolete covered.
I like dat man. You go help `im.                         I take care of dis sissy. Pillsbury, moving fast for a big woman, POUNDS Manolete's temple with a mighty fist. He drops like a lead weight.
89 The door to the roof opens and the GREASY MAN from "downt steps out of a fire stair with ANOTHER GREASY MAN. SUTHER remains inside the door.
I don't know about this. I mean...                       leavin' people behind...

Kaufman was gonna leave people behind. So we're leaving him.                            The Greasy Men go trotting across the rooftop. As they cl into TWO HELICOPTERS, we realize that they are PILOTS.
90 RILEY walks down the road. The GROWLING of the diesels is getting louder, the GLOW from the high-beams brighter. Ri is startled by a NOISE behind him. He whirls around and s CHARLIE approaching.
Everything's cool back there.                            Riley is about to object, when DEAD RECKONING comes rumbl around a corner a hundred yards down the street. Riley ch his watch again. 11:52.
Too late to send me back.
Put on your Sunday smile. Try to                        look friendly.
I am friendly. Just look at me you                      can tell I'm friendly.
91 In the cab, PRETTY BOY eases off the gas. CHOLO looks out windshield as the headlights strike...

Denbo. And his idiot. (Beat) Stop.                      Gimme the mike.                                         The vehicle crunches to a stop forty yards away. Pretty Boy hands Cholo a microphone. Cholo speaks into it.
How'd you get up here, Riley? INTERCUT: BETWEEN THE STREET AND DEAD RECKONING'S CAB.
Grabbed the T-Bird.
What are you doin' up here?
Tracking you. With this. Riley holds up his "Game Boy". Cholo looks surprised.
Truck's got a little transmitter in her belly. Sorry I never told you.
You were always a smart guy, Riley.                     Much smarter'n me.
You went and took off without                           inviting us along.
You weren't around to get invited.                      Anyway, I figured you wouldn't                          want in on this.
We want in on anything you got goin'.
(To Pretty Boy) Open up.
What're you, nuts?
Open up!
92 SLACK and PILLSBURY watch from the shadows as a HATCH OPE
93 RILEY and CHARLIE step on board. PRETTY BOY is at the controls. FOXY, ANCHOR, and SCAR stand nearby. Charlie is grinning like a badly scarred Cheshire cat.
The hell you so happy about?
Riley told me to smile. So's you'd let us come in.

I'd rather have you in here than                         out there.                                               KA-CHUNK! Cholo lifts his crossbow, pressing a loaded arr up under Riley's chin. BLOOD TRICKLES.
Who's the smart one now? Charlie is about to react when he feels Foxy's M-16 pokin into his back. Cholo looks into Riley's eyes.
Thought you were gonna quit. Here you are still working for the man.                       Kaufman sent you out here, didn't                        he? To get the truck back.
Yes.
94 SLACK and PILLSBURY creep forward, freezing as they see RILEY with the crossbow at his neck. Slack aims her K-90 CHOLO, RUSTLING branches as she moves.
That man pulls the trigger, he's                        dead.
95 CHOLO cocks his head outside.
Who else is out there?
Kaufman sent some guys with us.                         We took care of `em. I know you been up to Ross Park. Picked up some Johnsons, huh?
Yup. Pretty Boy, set the cannons.                       96
With great WHIRRING SOUNDS, the vehicle's largest guns be to ROTATE slowly toward the city across the river.
We're running out of time here. C'mon, Riley. Make yourself useful.                     MANOLETE begins to stir on the ground beside THE T-BIRD.
97 RILEY keeps cool.
Don't do it, Cholo.
Kaufman's got it coming.
98 SLACK and PILLSBURY watch THE GUN TURRET continue to turn the cannon barrels angling toward FIDDLER'S GREEN.
99 PRETTY BOY lifts a clear cover off a RED FIRING BUTTON.

Hit the tower square, you'll kill a                      lot of innocent people. Miss and                         hit the city, you'll kill a lot of                       our friends. Your beef's with                            Kaufman, not them.                                       The turret on the roof GROANS as the cannons rotate.

He's killed a lot of our friends.                        Every week we took out the garbage,                      you and me. Every month I took out                       Kaufman's garbage. People he wanted off the streets. He turned me into a                     goon and then he pissed all over me!                     Foxy, keep `em covered.
100 The turret stops, cannons aimed directly at the GREEN. 101
CHOLO moves to the RED FIRING BUTTON.
When the smoke clears, I'm gonna roll in, hit the bank, take the money, and pick up any other fancy                       shit I can get my hands on.
There won't be any fancy shit left.                      And money burns.
Not when you keep it in a safe.
102 MANOLETE pulls one of the MACHINE GUNS out of its mount o the T-BIRD. Shouldering it, he creeps toward DEAD RECKONI
103 ON THE CONTROL PANEL: A CLOCK CLICKS DOWN TO MIDNIGHT. 4...3...2...1...CHOLO reaches down and pushes the button.
104 The GUN BARRELS are cold. SILENT.
105 CHOLO punches the button again. Again. Nothing happens.
CHOLO'S eyes fall to the "Game Boy" in Riley's hand.
You did something, didn't you?                          With your FUCKING TOY!                                  Riley pushes another button on the "Game Boy". Outside...
106 ...TWO STEEL LOCKING RINGS swing up to cap the cannons. J beyond the barrels we see MANOLETE closing in on DEAD RECKONING, raising his machine gun. A DEAD THING advances behind him. 107
CHOLO charges RILEY. Grabs him around the throat.
Fix it!
Not a chance.                                           Riley tosses the "Game Boy" out the open hatch. Cholo rea out after it.

108 MANOLETE has the machine gun aimed at DEAD RECKONING'S op hatch. Where CHOLO is standing. Out of the corner of his eye, RILEY sees Manolete's machi gun barrel flash in the moonlight. MANOLETE FIRES! RATATA RILEY PUSHES CHOLO OUT OF THE WAY JUST IN TIME! He drops the hatch onto the pavement, wounded in the shoulder. The Walker starts to rip Manolete apart. Slack SHOOTS HIM the head. Then she and PILLSBURY open fire on the Walker, destroying it.
109 FOXY, distracted by the mayhem, lets CHARLIE get the drop him. ANCHOR and SCAR go for their guns. RILEY unslings hi M-16 and holds them at bay.
Easy boys.                                              Riley looks at the clock on the control panel. 12:01. Cha follows his gaze.
Geez. We just made it.                                  Riley CLICKS the transmitter on.
Riley Denbo calling the Green.                          110
BING! KAUFMAN steps off the elevator, carrying his two Pr bags full of money. A TWO-WAY RADIO in his pocket RINGS.
(Into radio, urgent) Yes?
We got Cholo.
(Sagging with relief) I owe you, Mister Denbo.
I'm glad you feel that way. Because                     I'm taking your fucking truck.
112 KAUFMAN rushes in with his bags, dropping them beside oth luggage that is already packed.
(Frightened) Mister Kaufman, sir. I                     dunno what's happening, sir, but it                     sounds bad.

The windows are sealed so the NOISE Kaufman hears is MUFF but it is definitely the SOUND OF DISORDER. He goes to a window. Looks down and sees... ...flashes of LIGHT from gunfire. SMOKE rising from an EXPLOSION. PEOPLE running. THE DEAD swarming into the cit like ants. A war has begun.
113 SUTHERLAND stands at the edge of the roof, looking down a what Kaufman just saw.

All this time Kaufman's been                            worried about a revolution on the                       streets. He never thought it would                      come from across the river. Sutherland, STYLES, OTHER BOARD MEMBERS, and their FAMILI get into the TWO HELICOPTERS.

114 THE SOUND OF RUMBLING. The CEILING VIBRATES, knocking tea shaped baubles off a CHANDELIER. The SOUND BUILDS in intensity. Then suddenly eases off. Through the window, KAUFMAN sees the things that caused the rumbling... ...TWO HELICOPTERS, SOARING off into the night.
No. No. They can't leave. Not without me!
I think they just did, sir.
115 RILEY jumps out onto the street where CHOLO lies, bleedin from the top of his left shoulder.
I hate you, Riley. There's                              something about you I've always                         fucking hated.
(Smiling) Same here.
Riley. Look out there.

Riley looks where SLACK is pointing. From across the rive comes a flickering ORANGE GLOW. Riley moves to a spot where he can see between the houses the hillside. In the distance, FIRE rises from the city. Cholo sits up, cackling. CHOLO
I didn't have to blow the fucking                       place up. Somebody else did for me!                     RILEY

(Stunned) The stenches. They got                        across the river. They got across                       the fucking river. (To the others)                      Get him inside.                                         PILLSBURY steps in and lifts Cholo easily to his feet. CHOLO
Wait, wait, wait. What are we                           doin'? Where we goin'?                                  RILEY
Back to the city.                                       CHOLO
Not this horse. You got the T-Bird?                     I'll take that. FOXY
Me, too. FOXY jumps out of DEAD RECKONING and stands at Cholo's si Riley, Slack, and Pillsbury climb aboard. Riley looks dow Cholo and Foxy. RILEY
You guys'd be safer coming with us.                     CHOLO
Nah, you'd never let me have any                        fun.                                                    RILEY
T-Bird's down that driveway over                        there. Guns and ammo inside.                            CHOLO
Thanks.

116 RILEY closes the hatch. Blood trickles from under his chi where Cholo stuck him with the crossbow. SLACK reaches up and pulls off the bandana that holds bac her hair, which cascades down. She uses the fabric to cle the blood off Riley's neck. He looks at her, touched by the familiarity of the gestur
Almost lost you there.
I don't get lost so easy. (To                            PRETTY BOY) We gotta get across                          the water.

The bridges into the city are all bricked up.                                              PRETTY BOY hits a button. A MAP appears on a MONITOR, sho the "GOLDEN TRIANGLE" bordered by the rivers and the barricaded bridges spanning them.
We could blast our way through.

Don't want to. If the stenches got                       in, there's a war going on in the city.
